values:
So last night, half asleep, I keep scratching my eye and nose. Scratch, scratch, scratch...finally I wake up and realize that a mosquito has chewed the SHIT out of my fucking face. 

I just have one thing to say: It so figures. So aside from looking like quasimodo for a majority of the morning, the day has been *thumbs up* just swell. Thankfully the bites went away...*sigh* I'm so done. 

But a quick note: I heart people who leave me comments in my LJ. lol. It makes my day, seriously guys. =) 

I've finished the Da Vinci Code. holyfuckgoodbook. Right up my alley. Yaaay sacred feminine. Although, I've been looking into articles online (articles NOT published by crazy Christians who Hate This Book for reasons rather obvious) and apparently he was talking out his ass in parts...but who knows. I guess that's why it's a good mystery. 

Dinner in a bit with the fam...

Whatever is eating me alive has taken my voice and ran away with it. I sound like my forty year old chain smoker self. Ya-tta. 

I feel like the best parts of my life are being wasted. I feel like I should have done/felt/been something more than than this by now. I feel wholly childish and stupid. Waves like these come and go and leave me totally confused as to where to go and what to do from here. I don't know how to go out and find my life, which is what needs to happen. Soon. 

at a loss. going for ice cream.

It's been awhile. Lesse...

~I went to Harry Potter two times this weekend. =) The first time was a midnight showing that I went to with Sam and Dean...I ended up winning a fifteen dollar gift certificate to Barnes and Noble for being a total Harry Potter WHORE. QUICK--Where did Harry and his parents live before Voldemort killed Lily and James?!?! hehehe Dark Tower Six, here I come. 
~Speaking of the movie, here's a spoiler happy <lj-cut text="opinion-type...thingy"> 
Sooo...there were many things that I was happy with, and many things that totally sucked ass. I'll start with the good things, just so people don't think I completely hated the movie, because I didn't. But I'm a nit-picking purist, so keep that in mind when you read it. Or, as Terri-chama described it: "You're Hermione, honey. Of COURSE you'd have issues with it." =) 

~ I did like the emotional backdrop to this movie. We had a lot less concern with how pretty and perfect the scenery and plot were, and a lot more emphasis on how the characters felt about and interacted with each other. I enjoyed that. 
~ Michael Gambon--the new Dumbledore--was chou beri good. At first I was concerned that he didn't bring any levity to the role, but after seeing it again, I liked his performance. He was energetic and much more of the Dumbledore I had envisioned. I missed Richard Harris' regal air, though. 
~ Yaaaaay for Lupin! There's big huge rumors going around now that Lupin was in love with Lily Potter. Oh, the wonders of taking liberties with scripts. It's great. Anyway, I was dead set on not liking Lupin OR Sirius, but I found I really, really liked Lupin and
~I got used to Sirius. He went too quickly, in my opinion, from raving lunatic to not so much a raving lunatic. But overall, I liked him. 
~It was funny!! Everything felt much more natural in terms of humor and expression. A majority of this humor came from Ron, who is becoming a very talented comedic actor. 
~ Snape was all protector-like and shit. It was strange, but kind of cool to see him placing himself before the students. I liked the scene where he tells the kids to turn to page "Three hundred and ninety ffffffffffour." heheh. 
~Malfoy is so very much in character. I love when he sizes Harry up before faking him out with a Dementor scare. So Draco. So awesome. 
~LOTS of Hermione and Ron sekshull tension scenes. This is ii. It was one thing I didn't mind them hyping up way more than the book did. lol. The more the better, in my opinion. 

THINGS THAT SUCKED: 
~ Okay. I had a major problem with how they characterized Ron and Hermione. They wrote the both of them very one dimensionally. Ron was used for little else than comic relief and he was entirely too cowardly for his character. Go back and read the books, guys...Ron is like, the first person to put his own safety before Harry's and Hermione's (he changed a bit in book five, though, i'll admit). And Hermione is not this badassed overachiever...overachiever, yes, and a key figure in the crucial bits of plot, yes. But Hermione lacks her insecurities and the loads of stress that she's under for a majority of the book. Instead she's this powerhouse girl who has everything under control at every point and time. Which is okay, but it's not the Hermione that JK Rowling created. There's a difference between a bitch slap and a punch, guys. And I didn't like how Hermione seemed to dominate every shot she was in. =/ I dunno, it irked me. 
~ I also didn't like how they left out ALL of the Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot and Prongs backstory. 
~ The ending was ghey. Totally ghey. 
There, I'm done bitching and reminding everyone how much of a psycho i am. </lj-cut>
~I LOVED LOVED LOVED seeing Maiko-chan, Terri-chama, and Chris-kun on Saturday. =) It was soooo awesome. I've missed them all very terribly. 
~Ditto for Keito-chama and Steve-kun, both of whom I've talked to recently. Steve's the luckiest bastard in the world for getting to see Tokyo. ;) And I miss my Keito-chama like. whoa. We had a good chat on the phone the other day, though. =) 
~I may have a job! Forty hours a week at walmart. ...It's money, I suppose. lol. 
~ MB sucks some serious dick. I haven't the time or energy to rant about it now, though. 

okay, no more typing for me. owari.

ok...here's my update. 

~Still no real job. *fingers crossed* 
~Feeling much better. 
~Saw the Day After Tomorrow which was a typical disaster film but kick ass nevertheless. Mucho suspense/destruction. It was chou beri good. 
~It's cold in New Hampshire. Very cold.
~Want coffee. 
~Saw Shrek 2 as well. It was cute. Not what I expected, but okay. 
~Helped out backstage at my sisters' recital on Sunday. Hell on Earth. Barely survived. Never want kids. 
~Currently reading: Lightning by Dean Koontz. I heart Dean Koontz. This book is amazing, and I highly recommend it. 
~Harry Potter dinner/movie in four days! 
~Contemplated becoming a hooker for approximately three seconds in sheer desperation only common to poor people. Wave of hysteria thankfully passed before any venereal diseases could be caught. 
~Siblings driving me crazy. 
~Still want coffee. 
~Worried about intermediate Spanish in the fall. Should probably begin review-like things. 
~Nothing else to say. Goodnight all.

sick. that is all. 


on the one really nice day since last saturday, too...

Oha!

So, naturally, the first week that I'm home, everybody has to get sick. EVERYONE. I'm very scared that I'm next. Elementary schools are teeming with illness. 

I'm finally going to get to watch Lost in Translation! I'm practically the only person I know who hasn't watched that damn movie yet. I think that will be tonight's plans. 

And I kind of really wish that the weather would turn...but apparently it's supposed to be crappy five out of seven days this week. -_- Booooo. I'm actually quite cold right now. 

Currents: 
Job status: I've given into whoring myself out back at the MB due to lack of money and lack of new job. I hope something works out. 
Music: I actually like a Beyonce song. I know, you can yell at me alll you want. 
People coming to Harry Potter movie/dinner: Two. (yaay terri-chama!) I expect a better turn out than this, bitches. ;) 

Aieee...and I get to pimp out my 'puuuuterrr...wireless mouse/keyboard and (provided that the monitor on the family computer kicks the bucket sometime soon) a flat screen monitor. =D I'm excited.

Well, as much as it may not be what I would prefer to be doing for the summer, I may end up working at another supermarket. BUT--I'd be payed $8.00/8.25 an hour (50 cents more than MB) and I'll probably end up working a good deal of hours, which is what I really need to do. 

I cleaned the house like a mofo today. It was crazy. The house looks pretty damn good. I also had a good chat with Jen, which was very ii. It was nice catching up with her, and I'm glad we haven't lost touch. 

Last night I went to Barnes and Noble with Sam and we just got coffee, sat, talked, and putted around the store--high on my list of favorite summer activities. 

All right, seeing as how it's only two weeks away from today, I'm putting out the call now: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban viewing-gathering-type-thing. Who wants to accompany me on opening day or the following day? Dinner before/after?

Hey. Livejournal. Back. Whooo. 

Let's see...over the past few days I've spent an obscene amount of money on various things, including an OMFG SPIKEY TAILED BETTA that I really didn't need but who is chou cool. I am currently accepting ideas for names--if I don't get something better, I'm going to name it Tom. If you'd like to stop this heinous act of fan girl-dom, please try. =) 

And now my brother is asking for help on his Spanish homework, reminding me that I have to get cracking on that review type stuff this summer...damn. 

Currents: 
Pets: Now, technically...5. >.< 
Music: I can't stop listening to Big Boi. Every five seconds now, it's really rather obnoxious. 
Books: I'm trying to simultaneously read Insomnia by Stephen King and Love in the Time of Cholera by Gabriel Garcia Marquez (thanks to Andy). I'm finding it really hard to get into Love in the time of Cholera for some reason...hopefully it'll pick up a bit. 
Job Attempts: 3
Job Rejections: 2
Planned Attempts: 3

aii-ya.

Talk about being so effing frustrated with yourself...

I'm still the license-less wonder, and it's weighing on my head pretty damn heavily. =/ I'm sick of being stupid about this. I've asked my parents if they can take me driving, but my mom refuses to drive with me and my father doesn't have the time, point blank. 




and i make too many excuses. 


*sigh* everything is just...meh.

(heavy sarcasm)
I was saying to myself the other day, "You know...it's March, and we've already had a few really nice sixty degree days...but, you know...there just isn't enough snow around here. I miss winter! Good god, I need more snow." I guess my wishes were filled! *thumbs up* 
(end heavy sarcasm)

I'm going to get to translating in a little bit. I need to make some headway on that. And I have to make a few phone calls for employment, etc...

I've been having really vivid dreams lately...and they've been really cool dreams. I can remember my dreams ordinarily, but these have been unusually clear. Kinda cool. 


So yeah. Off to translate/read/playdiddykongracinguntilibeatthefucker/and what not...

An update! Why the hell not. 

Vacation is going fairly well, for the most part. My Mom has been avid about going places, shopping, etc, so I've been occupied. I got my hair cut! There aren't any layers anymore, and I don't know how I feel about that. I'm so anal about my frickin' hair. 

Bailey is so effing hilarious. We were at the mall, and my Mom went to go look in Noah's--a store that sells collectibles. Five year olds and stores with breakable stuff don't really mesh, so I took her to Express instead. We went around looking at clothes, and she was like my very own personal shopper:

Me: Bailey, what do you think of this shirt?
Bailey: Nah, that wouldn't look good on you. 
Me: Okay, how about this? This is cute!
Bailey: Oh, PERFECT! But you need more pink. Get more pink. 
Me: Oo, what about this?
Bailey: Uhh, I'd try that on first if I were you. 

And then we were discussing where to find Mom. 

Me: Noah's is this way, Bailey.
Bailey: No, Momma went THIS way. 
Me: No, I'm pretty sure she went this way. 
Bailey: Dude, have you even BEEN in this mall? 

Sometimes I can't believe that kid is only five. 

I'm anxious to get back to fencing. I *really* want to practice...I'm pretty psyched about nationals, actually. 

The Etch-A-Sketch (also known as: The Family Computer) has been giving me problems lately with viruses and adware/spyware and all sorts of fun stuff. I couldn't use internet explorer for a few days because of some stupid trojan. Oh, and I might not have internet access when I get back up to school because of the Nachi virus that I may have picked up--awesome. Jesus Christ, it's like a fucking compy epidemic. 20 cc's laticane on the rapid infuser! Too...much...ER...

I was supposed to go see Sammy in Boston this week, but that doesn't look like it's going to happen--my Mom is working, and I need to hold down the fort. =/ 

Spring Bonus from the MB! 38 WHOLE DOLLARS. Don't know WHAT I'm gonna do this week. -_- 

Now let's see if I actually continue writing in here...

wah. 

You know...fuck. I was gonna start complaining but what's the use? I'm not entirely sure I want to listen to myself whine...then again, I'm the only one I can complain to without feeling all bad about it and whatnot.

Confused? Me too. Do me a favor and close your browser window, 'kay? Thanks. 

So something's not right *again* and I can't quite figure out what *AGAIN.* Fuck you, March. (It's nice to have a convenient excuse such as the current month to blame all of your mood swings on. Try it sometime.) 

Oy, to hell with this.

I'm so weird--I'll write in ONE journal, then go post in ANOTHER. Lol. I have way too much time on my hands. 

I'm in one of those good/bad moods...more good than bad, luckily, though I've been annoyed on and off for a few days now. But the weather is so nice that I've perked up a bit...I even bought myself a Gerber Daisy today! yay! It's so pink and pretty and sitting on my desk. *sigh* 

It's March, though...and March and I have a long-standing love-hate relationship. I wonder if it'll continue this year...kinda hope not. 

Boo for rain on the weekends, btw. You better hold off, rain. Dammit.

Today was yaywarm! I was very happy. I didn't need a jacket, and it was just peachy. Of course, I spent the day in the library reading shit for school, but that's all right. Tomorrow is supposed to be WARMER. I *may* bust out the skirt. 

I spent like, all weekend watching Will and Grace. Thank god for that DVD set...I absolutely heart that show. Jack and Karen are chou awesome. I want a gay friend like Jack. 

A bit of annoyance...I don't like when I'm sought out for advice, I try to give advice, and the I'm blown off like I don't know what I'm talking about. That kind of pissed me off.

I'm feeling a bit better, though...hopefully when I go to fencing tomorrow night, and I *will* go, goddammit, I don't blow up. That would not be so much fun. 

Okay...Nihongo and the Oscars. Sounds like an evening to me.

This journal entry is brought to you by Mike and Steve, who apparently claim that I should be bitching and moaning more if I am to keep a livejournal. Here goes! *thumbs up*


So...the past couple of days, my heart has been pounding really hard and really fast and really irregularly. I went to the doctor today, and she told me that my heart sounds fine, but I may be anemic, meaning my blood isn't oxygenated enough, so my heart is working to compensate. I also may have a low iron count and my blood pressure is UBER low. Tomorrow I have to go get all sorts of fun blood tests done. hoo-rah. 

I hung out with the boyz tonight, and Mike made some kick ass dinner...it was broccoli and mushrooms in a vegetable sauce with rice and yum. AND KILL BILL WAS SOOO COOOL. I'd been wanting to see that movie for awhile. 

Okay. I'm tired, and I just finished my ass-kissing scholarship letter, and I'm facing a weekend solo...oyasumi.

I have a friend, his name is Mike.  He rocks.  He is my bestest friend in the whole wide world.  Words cannot begin to describe just how cool Mike is.  I think the next time I see him I will have to give him a big hug and shower him with adoration, because, well, he is Mike.  That's right Mike, you rock!

 

 

 

 

 

(i'm so dead)

I was so frickin' worried about my linguistics exam, that my stomach actually *hurt.* Fuck, I'm a loser. heh. 

And now I'm procrastinating, which is working just fine for me. 


I promise one of these days I'll have something to say, but as for right now, I think I'm mildly retarded.



"Well, why don't we be each other's soul mates? And men can just be nice guys we have fun with." 
~Charlotte~

Home was all right. It was good to see the family, Sammy, and tacos. 


AND I might have a way to get to Japan this summer...more on this as it unfolds. 

Bai bai, Sex and the City. I promise to honor you by purchasing a DVD set when I have the money.

I got my first caffeine headache today. I feel like I've gone through some right of passage, or something. 

Yay for old episodes of er, too. This week hasn't been all that bad. I'm just kind of worried about the Linguistical stuff that's coming up...I get some of it, still kinda shaky on a bit of it...hopefully when I talk to Naomi today she can clear up some stuff. 

And I go home tomorrow night! yay!!

We got our apartment!! WE. GOT. OUR. APARTMENT! 

It's going to be fucking SWEET. Okay...stress-age, though--when we got there, they told us that they only had ONE five person apartment left at the beginning of the night, so the chances of it still being there were slim. We were kind of nervous (hell, *really* nervous), but we got our credit tally and sat down. 

So, right before they call up all the girls to get in line, we ask the woman if they have any five person apartments left. She says they have ONE left. eeeeep.

Beth (future roommate) runs like hell up to the line, finds out that between us all we have an ASSLOAD of credits, and she's first in line. 

Apartment = SO OURS. 

After we had established via hand signals that we did indeed have the apartment, Alicia (another future roommate) speculates: "Wouldn't it be perfect if it were sixth floor B tower? *wistful sigh* " 

Kate comes back with the news. Sixth Floor B Tower. 

The night is perfect. 

I'm a just a lil' happy. =D

It's so very Monday today. Every week seems longer and longer...

I'm looking forward to going home, though, even if it's only for a day and a half. I miss it. 

I was thinking today how much stuff has changed. I really haven't noticed, or thought about it, but today when I was walking downtown it came upon me from out of nowhere. I like where I am right now. And while some things are irksome or not exactly how I'd envisioned, mostly I'm pretty okay with how things have turned out. (fits of depressive-ness aside. no really.) 

I've fallen out of touch with many people...in some cases, that's for the better. In others, not so much. I'm starting to feel a bit more like my own person, and not so terribly influenced by what other people think of me (though that's a trait that's really hard to break =/). 

And the people around me up here are awesome. hontou ni arigatou. 

Sorry. =P Didn't meant to spout...usually I save crap like that for elsewhere, but I felt the need to broadcast it for some stupid reason. heh.

Hahahaha, I don't know about everyone else, but my plans included a night with the fencing girls, some really effing BIZZARE hentai and more chocolate than any six people were meant to consume. For real. 

Work was okay. Mildly irritating, but that's all right. I get paid on Monday! *does the happy getting paid dance!*

I ate wayyyyyy too fucking much tonight. Seriously. It's time to drop into a food-induced coma right about now, i think.

Nothing really to say, 'cept it's Thursday, and that means my nihongo no squishies and I are going out! yay!
French Guard- I'm French! Why do think I have this outrageous
accent, you silly king!

What Monty Python Character are you?
brought to you by Quizilla haha, I got the killer bunny the first time. http://www.stilllight.com/assets/images/gerber_daisies_w_stems.jpg ~bounces!~ I love these fucking flowers!!!! I had to cut them and make them look all pretty today for about two and a half hours, and I grew rather attached. lol. I can't wait till I have money to buy some.

Not really too much going on, besides my unending frustration over stupid financial aid, and how it seems to be messing with everything I want to do. ever. 

That and i've been quite easily irritated over little things, lately. I'm thinking that needs to stop. 

and maybe one day i'll be able to do all the shit i say i can/will.

Fencing could have gone a lil' better yesterday. I dunno. At least I have stuff to work on now. I REALLY have to find a way to finagle going to New Englands. *pout.* 

And I'm amazingly sore today. And really tired, which makes for a sucky combo. But I'm feeling a teeny bit better now. At least I'm awake. Yay for coffee! 

Okay...I think people need to go see a motivational speaker that will be coming to UNH on Tuesday, February 17th. He'll be talking about how to deal with stupid people. And his name is Jonathan SPRINKLES. Yes. Sprinkles. That's the sole reason why Kate and I will be in attendance. 

That and he sounds like a fucking riot. In that sincere motivational speaker way. 

I'm not working until Thursday now. YEAH not getting paid. Ah well. Thursday will shape up to be a good day, though.

I feel like i'm in a coma. Even coffee didn't help. And today is really really nice, too--forty one degrees! holy crap! I didn't need a winter jacket! Yay for the eradication of SDS. Whoo-hoo! 

And tomorrow we have tournament action going down...should be worlds of fun. =D I'm really looking forward to it, and I'm not nervous at all--which is interesting, because it was pretty much standard for me to be a wreck the entire day before any sort of tournament last semester. It's so cool--I didn't expect to see myself *improving,* but every time I practice, things become easier and easier...*^^* 

I need to get to the mall at some point. I wonder if I'll have the motivation to do that today. 

Hahaha, this was amusing.

OMG I NEED A TACO. Seriously, I haven't had a good taco in WEEKS. Possibly even MONTHS. Holy. Crap.

You are Blue.
Overall you're a pretty content person. At peace
with yourself, you don't tend to over react.
Although at times you can be quite harsh and
cold towards others.

What Color Best Represents Your Personality?
brought to you by Quizilla i like blue.

brought to you by Quizilla hahahhahah yeah probably.

Simply put... you are leader material, but dont

Which Angel Lays Within You?
brought to you by Quizilla lol. i'm done, i swear. well, for today. maybe over mike's tonight. working all day tomorrow. can't form complete sentences. want to take a nap.

I loathe being ill. I really do. I think it's time for Sudafed and bedtime. yeah. Sounds good. 

It sucks too, I really wanted to bout tonight at fencing.
=( Wtf, head cold. W.T.F. I better shake this shit fast, seeing as how I have a big week coming up, and I really don't wanna feel like crud. 

Not feeling too hot in general...doesn't necessarily relate to my health. arr.

I feel like I'm mildly retarded lately. I have all sorts of coherent thoughts in my head, but the minute I try to vocalize them, it's like I've lost some crucial portion of my brain. It all comes out disjointed and such. Kinda sucks, actually. 

I feel like I have a lot to do. I wonder if I really do, or it's all in my head. hrm.

I actually didn't suck at bouting tonight! W00t. I thought I was going to really just totally blow, but it was okay. =D And the Gay Pimp Party/Funny Internet Stuff party afterwards was pretty sweet-ass too. 

Terri-chama came to fencing! I hope she decides to come back. (As I know she reads this, Terri-chama, go to another practice! Onegaaaai! =) ) 

I started training today. Ten hundred million things to learn. Seriously. Who ever knew fucking flower shops were so fucking complicated. But they're paying me, so complicate it up, dammit. I did two hours today, I'll do two and a half tomorrow, and then whatever on Friday. 

Okay. It's almost midnight. I should be doing other stuff besides updating this thing.

Well, I did a whole lot of nothing yesterday, but I've never felt so good about doing so little. Nothing = yay. Oh...I *did* put together a lil' scrapbook type...thing of all the cool doodles I've done in my notebooks. Lol. I doodle when I'm bored. I must have been bored a whole lot last semester. Tournament next Sunday! I'm excited. I feel like I should be doing more work than I'm doing. Hm...I think I've gotten everything done that I needed to. I should be stressing the word 'think.' PANTS AT EXPRESS FOR SIX BUCKS HOLY HELL. I went with Thora yesterday to the mall where these obscene sales were going on. It was really nice to see Thora too, even though she isn't coming back to school next semester. =( She's out in Chicago, juggling. Goddamn, Thora has a cool life. Had breakfast with Jill this morning--I've missed Jill. She always has such cool stories to tell. =D Ok. I'm out. Go Pats!
Your wings are BROKEN and tattered. You are
an angelic spirit who has fallen from grace for
one reason or another - possibly, you made one
tragic mistake that cost you everything. Or
maybe you were blamed for a crime you didn't
commit. In any case, you are faithless and
joyless. You find no happiness, love, or
acceptance in your love or in yourself. Most
days are a burden and you wonder when the
hurting will end. Sweet, beautiful and
sorrowful, you paint a tragic and touching
picture. You are the one that few understand.
Those that do know you are likely to love you
deeply and wish that they could do something to
ease your pain. You are constantly living in
memories of better times and a better world.
You are hard on yourself and self-critical or
self-loathing. Feeling rejected and unloved,
you are sensitive, caring, deep, and despite
your tainted nature, your soul is
breathtakingly beautiful.

*~*~*Claim Your Wings - Pics and Long Answers*~*~*
brought to you by Quizilla ouch. lol.

After a night of sweet-ass Olive Garden food, a new shirt that makes me look fairly hot, and hanging out with teh cool that is my nihongo no tomodachi, I'm feeling much better. They managed to lift the ridiculous weight off my shoulders. Arigatou, kids. =D

Maiko-chan is awesome. He took us out for dinner and he deserves a huge show of gratitude. Therefore, I shall give the ultimate display of thanks. 

Here goes. 

You ready? 

Baa. 

Mark that, it probably won't happen again. 

Terri-chama, Keito-chama and I were mad-crazy. But that's perfectly okay by me, as I needed to laugh that loudly and that hard. And by the way--I think I may need to take a trip back to the Olive Garden to find that waiter. =D We can all sing for him. We SO should have given him our autographs. I mean...we *are* a bitchin' new band. It could have gone like "Terri and Da Bitches 4 Eva. ur so cool and hott. so r we."

And Steven-kun always manages to put me to sleep. lol. AND he got me hooked on this incredible online comic strip that EVERYONE SHOULD SEE AND LAUGH AT BECAUSE IT IS SO FUNNY AND I HEART IT. It's called Sinfest, and you can see it at Sinfest.net. Steven-kun is responsible for getting me hooked on many new manga/comic strips this week. lol. I don't know whether to thank him profusely or yell at him. hehe. 

Note to Sammy: I heart you, hon, and things will be all right, somehow. Ne? Hang in there. Bust out your Tinkerbell Underoos and do a lil' dance. *hugs* This summer will be this shit, if I can swing it. =)

I think I have some sort of disorder. Thankfully, today I was able to pull myself up and out of my stupid misery and be somewhat of a cheerful person. Yesterday I could barely stand *myself,* so I don't know how other people put up with me. =/ But thankfully, I think people kinda sorta care, which is nice. =)

AND HEY--I *almost* met Drew Barrymore the other day! Lol...well, I walked by her in the MUB. She's really short. I wasn't even sure that it was her at first, but then my RA's away message said that he met her, so I'm assuming...

I was like *this* close! lol. I'm such a fangirl. 

The translations I worked oh-so-hard on should be online soon! You all can take a look because I'll be advertising them here. hehe. 

I have to go home next weekend to do some random stuff...pffbt. I gotta be home before Sunday, though, due to tournament-age.

This post is entirely for Terri-chama, who, by the way, is the shit. 

She brought me hazelnut coffee the other day, AND she's thinking about joining the fencing team. (doitdoitdoitdoitdoit)

Terri-chama, I salute you.

First week of classes done. And I already feel like I've been doing this for much too long of a time. 

Went to Goodwill yesterday and tried on some HOT pants, and got the Twister Soundtrack. heh. And I'm totally hooked on a new manga series called Marmalade Boy by Wataru Yoshizumi. Nice job, Steve. LOL. It's one of those never-ending romantic comedies that I am so prone to liking even though the premise is rather tired. 

I have a job! Well, for a week. lol. The week of Valentine's Day, I'll be helping out the flower/gift shop downtown. Hey, I'll take what I can get. 

I went through my translations with Pam the other day...I got a fair amount of it! I was surprised...I thought I'd be way off on all of it. Turns out just the important plot points were what threw me. LOL. But she said I did well, and was completely on par with what I should be understanding of the language. That was good to know. 

And now...to the homework. *sigh*

As usual, the morning after always looks better/different. I'm not crazy, I promise. 

Moody, but not crazy. 

I really like my classes so far--granted I've only been to *two* of them, and one of them hasn't really changed...lol. Linguistics seems like it's going to be an awesome class--I'm pretty excited about that. I have my Japanese/Chinese seminar today and CS right after...=/ We'll see how those go. 

Tomorrow should be a good day--Terri-chama-sama will be hanging with us and making dinner. And I'm going to be meeting with Pam after class so we can go over my mistake-riddled translation-y stuff. And fencing is tonight. 

Add it all up and it equals goodness. 

Another equation: (porn + sex) + Gackt = perv. (ask mike to prove this one out for you.) 

Bailey Quote:
Bailey: When I lose a tooth, I don't want the Tooth Fairy to bring me money. I want a credit card. 
Mom: Honey, the Tooth Fairy doesn't give credit cards. She gives *money.*
Bailey: *ponder* *sigh* Fine, then maybe Santa will bring me one. 


All I wanna do is sleep in my bed where it's nice and warm and comfy.

I have to stop being how I am. I have to stop thinking the way that I do. Why do I have to take everything so literally? Why can't I remember that people don't always mean what they say? Why do I focus on every little thing that happened so long ago instead of looking at what's ahead of me, here, now? 

Why can't I come to grips with the fact that I just might not be something all that important? 


Why does the same thing throw me into a depression *every time* I see it? Because my time feels like it's running out and my life feels like it's amounting to nothing and there's a part of me that *won't wake up.*

Maybe it can't. Maybe it's not supposed to. 

If that's the case, I just wish all of this would go away and let me return to how I want to be.

"this is the end. this story's old, but it goes on and on until we disappear. calm me and let me taste the salt you breathed while you were underneath. i am the one who haunts your dreams of mountains sunk below the sea. i spoke the words but never gave a thought to what they all could mean. i know that this is what you want. a funeral keeps both of us apart. you know that you are not alone. need you like water in my lungs. this is the end."

I like this. I found it in Meghan's away message. I wonder if it's hers, or if she found it somewhere...

I have wayyyy too much stuff. Seriously. 


AND I FORGOT STUFF. I hate it when that happens. Stupid alarm clock. And dvds. YEAH. 

The good news is I may be able to live in the apartments next year...that was in some dispute, apparently...but luckily, it looks like it's do-able. Which is nice. 

Now that I'm back up here, I have a buttload of stuff to do, wah. I failed to remember all the lil' odds and ends that are involved with the spring semester. Oh financial aid. I heart you only not really. =P 

I'm sorta looking forward to classes tomorrow...not waking up for classes, but the classes themselves might be all right. I have Nihongo as usual, and then my Intro to Linguistics class. I'm interested to see how that one's going to go. 

Ok. I've blathered on, you have your entry, now I'm going to go write before I lose the motivation.

By this time tomorrow *crosses fingers* I should be back at school. Yay! And I'll be going back with a semi-decent amount of money, so all's well kinda. I still am very much looking forward to getting a job up at school. 

Last night I went up to Maine with Sammy, and an interesting proposition fell into my lap: Her mother is offering the house up there for Sam and I (and possibly one of Sam's roommates from school) *for the summer.* Whoa. 

That would be beyond awesome. THEORETICALLY I should have my license by then, so I'd have my car up there, I could get a good paying job at one of the fifty million tourist attractions/restaurants/hotels...and I'd be at a beach house all. summer. 

Now, the question is...how do I go about running this by my parents who still have the umbilical cord attached just a *lil* bit??

Any ideas? =( I really want to do this. I'm really, really sure they're going to be DEAD SET against it. 

fernt. 

Today is so...blah.

I went out with Sammy and Joel last night. It was pretty fun. We saw "Big Fish," which was a good movie--not quite what I was expecting, but still good. After, we went to Bickford's and had hot chocolaTE (only one, as Joel would point out). 

Of course, my parents were all pissed off that I was out until one thirty. *insert exasperated sigh here*. Am...am I not...oh how old am I again...ALMOST TWENTY? 

ANYways...

School in two days. 

I kinda hope I'm not going to be stuck in the house today...I need to get away from this place. Bad.

Frustration. 
Aggrivation. 
I think that's about all I have to report. 

Besides fact that I need a J-O-B job. And some S-A-N-I-T-Y sanity. 


"It'll be just like a sleepover! Only we'll be sweaty and covered with GREASE." 

~Spongebob

I'm going to work tonight!! *blinks* wait...was that...excitement? Going without money does strange things to the brain. Only six more days until semester two! That's it!! I do have good cause to be excited about that, I believe. Though I haven't translated ANYthing while I've been home (bad me), I have done some work on my story. Chapter four, baby, whoo-hooo. lol. I only started this last MAY. But this is the longest I've ever stuck with an idea, so hopefully I can make it work. Anou...
Congratulations! You're Sam!

My weekend since I got dropped off at my house on Saturday afternoon hasn't exactly been the best of times. I don't know what the hell is wrong with me, but it's obviously something rather substantial (okay, I'm lying. I know perfectly well what is wrong, but it's not for broadcast on a livejournal. gomen ne.). I think I teetered on the edge of a mini nervous breakdown, seeing as how I would almost cry (or in some cases, go right ahead and do it) in public places like church and my job. 

I've worked through it, in a fashion. I still don't feel terribly great, but at least I've collected myself and have stopped acting like a psychopathic lunatic. I need to get my shit together, though. =/

And insomnia kicked my ass again last night. I was really really tired too, so it's strange that I couldn't fall asleep. 

On a good and unrelated note, I finished Wolves of the Calla. I won't give away anything, but there was a part that actually made me laugh quite hysterically(one of the few things that did make me laugh, yesterday). A shiny quarter and a Pop Tart to anyone who can guess what could POSSIBLY be in a Stephen King book to make me laugh that hard. (Anyone who has read Wolves of the Calla forfeits Sorry. That'd be like...cheating!) 

No work again for me today. No money again for me today. Su-prise.

I'm in a rather sort of yay mood. 


time for asagohan!!

Today is the DAY! YAY for short hair. The only downside is I have to work tonight, boo on that. BUT ER is on on, so whoo hoo! I wonder if Kate will actually watch it now that the obsessee isn't there to force feed it. ;) 

I'm almost finished Wolves of the Calla, too, and I have a feeling I'm going to be extraordinarily unsatisfied with how it ends. DAMN these damn series!! Why is everything I get interested in a damn seven book/three movie saga? I can't take the waiting!!! 

Hopefully I can hang out with Sammy tonight because I won't be around tomorrow night, and Saturday I'm working until nine thirty. =P Poo.

A DAY TO JUST DO NOTHING. Thank GOD. 


I'm going to do so much nothing, it isn't even FUNNY. Oh, and for the record...I am officially dirt. poor. Well...sort of. I'm hell bent on not depositing any checks until I go back to school so I won't be tempted to compulsively spend the money, as I am so very prone to doing. Lol, of course, that means I have probably about...oh...two dollars in my account now. heh. 

I had a very funny conversation with Steve and Mike last night. I hope I didn't scare any outside parties. lol.

This is really just an entry to say I updated. Yeah. If you want to find me, I'll be at the Market Basket in Londonderry, New Hampshire, until, oh I dunno, THE REST OF MY LIFE. I can't WAIT until this weekend is over and I can get to NEXT weekend. For. Real.
